testCases.explanation: Start at station 3: +4-1=3, go to 4: +5-2=6, go to 0: +1-3=-2+6=4... completing the circuit
Total gas (9) < total cost (10); impossible to complete circuit
Single station; start at 0, net gain = 0, circuit completes
Single station with surplus; start at 0
Start at station 4: +4-1=3, go to 0: +5-4=4, go to 1: +1-4=-2 fail? No: carry 3+4=7-4=3, 3+5-4=4, 4+1-4=1, 1+2-1=2, 2+3-5=0. Circuit completes.

description: There are n gas stations along a circular route. You are given two integer arrays gas and cost. gas[i] is the gas at station i and cost[i] is the cost to travel from station i to the next. Return the starting gas station's index if you can travel around the circuit once in the clockwise direction, otherwise return -1.

examples.explanation: Start at station 3 (index 3) and fill up with 4 unit of gas. Your tank = 0 + 4 = 4. Travel to station 4...
